runs.comm: over the wicket, angled in and straightening from back of a length, blocked into the off side
banged in and swerving away as Lumb wafts the feather duster - too wide and called
full and straight this time and chipped over the infield, it spin off the turf out towards deep midwicket and nearly wrongfoots the fielder but he recovers
good response, bearing the bat with a length ball in the channel outside off
beaten again, lovely shape on the ball from Boult as it curves in and then out past Lumb's groping push
straighter, on a length and turned with a close of the bat face through square leg
touch short and swinging back at the batsman, chopped into the leg side, Hales wants two but has to settle
back of a length, angled across and beating Hales outside off
pitched up and driven powerfully through the covers on the front foot, excellent timing and that races away

bowled 'im, taxi for Hales! He tried to turn the ball to leg, playing across the line, and there was just a touch of seam movement away, enough deviation off the pitch to take it past the bat and thundering into the top of off stump

full and drives... and edged low to gully! That's a golden duck for Wright and England are quacking, quaking, cracking up. McClenaghan maintained a fullish, straightish line, Wright didn't really move his feet and a tentative prod resulted in a thick outside edge - plenty on it to reach Guptill, crouching low to safely pouch
full and angled across and left alone outside off
straighter line, blocked into the leg side from in front of the stumps
good angle and away movement from Boult again, drawing Lumb out and beating the bat
straighter, on the stumps and pushed back down the wicket
shorter, Lumb advances and tries to slog over midwicket, instead plays an air shot ... NZ joining the dots now
gets half forward and swings across the line again, gets a bottom edge past the stumps for a single
touch full but this is a super shot, hit on the up from the crease, Bairstow's strong forearms transferring enough power to beat the man at cover
ah, that's even better, superb placement and a full flow of the bat, piercing the covers again
pitched up outside off, not a lot more than a check drive, this, and it comes high off the bat but still sails over mid-off and runs away to the boundary
length, on the stumps, played back down the track
edges across and hit on the pad trying to hit over midwicket again, no bat involved but might have been sliding down leg and the umpire shakes his head
good pace on this, fired across the bows and beating Bairstow all ends up
full and straight, jabbed defensively into the off side
spot on yorker to finish the over, full and dipping around off stump, Bairstow plugs the gap in time
short and goes back to pull through square leg
pitched up, on the off stump, played back

dug in, loops off the glove and plops into the hands over short fine leg - another one down! Bairstow has thrown it away there, a short ball down the leg side, maybe a touch quicker than the batsman expected and instead of ramming it to the boundary he tamely flipped it to the man on the edge of the circle
back of a length and pushed across, swing and a miss
short and angled across, played into the body off the back foot, rolls towards point
on a length and fired across, Morgan's happy to let it through
length ball, gets forward and pushes into the off side
full and wide and leaving Lumb a touch, he goes hard and slices high, thick outside edge but it's fine of third man and only one bounce for four
good length, tries to heave across the line and misses out
length ball again, bit of an agricultural chop and an inside edge pings through midwicket, in the air but safe
full and straight and punched through mid-on for a single
pitched up outside off, gets forward to drive but picks out the man at cover
short and wide, Morgan had backed away but manages to get a toe on it and scrapes a boundary to third man
stays in the crease and his hit on the body by a short-of-a-length ball
touch full and pushed across outside off, punched to mid-off on the front foot
good length, again gets forward to drive to mid-off, bellows "No!"
short and at the body, blocked into the on side
angled across, slightly back of a length and defended short on the off side - five dot balls after that opening four and another excellent over for New Zealand
tossed up on middle and leg, worked short of midwicket
stays back and taps down the track

oh my, how has he survived that?! Morgan was beaten in the flight, beaten past the bat, but the stumps remained undisturbed and McCullum, B shelled the ball off his brother to squander the stumping chance
bit of width, skidding through wide of the stumps, slapped through point and that will run away
angled in and turned off the pads
touch short, goes back and farms one through the covers
short of a length, angled across and Morgan swings and misses
another failure to launch for the batsman, this was a bit too tight to cut and Morgan swipes forlornly
length ball on the stumps, blocked into the leg side
excellent line and length from Butler, tight to the stumps, chopped to point off the back foot

slapped straight down the throat of deep midwicket and dropped! Morgan went for his six-shooter but this was pop-gun stuff, picking out Rutherford, who must have holes in his hands to have dropped that
pulled off the back foot low through midwicket

advances, flicks the pad and bowled! Lumb's birthday party has been pooped and he goes for a pedestrian 17 from 23 balls, he was aiming to hit McCullum over midwicket, the ball skidded on, hit the knee roll and clipped the top of leg stump
over the wicket, angled in and squeezed back past the bowler
pushed through and driven down the ground
goes back outside off and flips the ball round the corner for another single
round the wicket, touch short and wide, cracked to the man at point off the back foot
shifts around in the crease, makes room for the cut and gets this one away

a scratchy innings is put out of its misery but a high top edge towards deep backward point. There was a bit of width but another England batsman fails to time the ball, Morgan slopes off and that's a second scalp for Butler
banged in short and scooped towards short fine leg, it came off the top edge but the keeper couldn't get across
goes back and chops into the off side
full and straight, deflects into the leg side
pitched up and slamming into the pads, Butler lets off a fog-horn appeal but umpire Baxter turns him down. Sliding down leg? Hint of inside edge?
thunderous bouncer, Buttler gets in a bit of a tangle and the ball rolls square for a leg bye
pitched up outside off stump and beats the bat as Buttler swings wildly
on the stumps and tapped into the covers
stays back and defends from the crease
dug in short, Patel waits on it and cracks a pull shot in front of deep midwicket for a much-needed boundary
short and at the man, pulled squarer this time to the man in the deep
full and wide and bunted back down the ground for a one-bounce four through long-off
round the wicket, turned into the leg side
shorter and sailing through over the stumps as Buttler tries to dab off the back foot
slower ball, manages to nurdle it into the leg side for another one
it's all going wrong for England and New Zealand are steamrollering this, as Patel scoops a drive to mid-off and is run out by a direct hit. He was yards short, good arm from Boult
pitched up and drilled towards cover, Ross Taylor stops it smartly to prevent a run
another slower ball, on the stumps and turned into the leg side
drags this wide on the off side
tossed up, Buttler picks it up on middle and leg and thumps it between deep midwicket and long-on for four
short and sprayed wide of the stumps again, this time Buttler can get bat on it and he carves it over cover-point to the rope
tossed up and pushed into the covers
round the wicket, flat and wide of the stumps, punched to mid-off
full and flighted, right under Buttler's nose and he murders a straight drive back down the ground, very fine of long-on, that's another consolation four
length ball, touch wide, reaches for it and manages to toe it through backward point
good, fierce bouncer to begin with and Buttler can't connect
full and wide, Buttler swings and it hits the toe of the bat, just loops wide of Franklin in his follow-through
round the wicket, length ball outside off, swing and a miss
back of a length, no foot movement and chipped lamely into the hands of mid-off. New Zealand are drawing the curtains on this sorry England effort
full and wide and drilled to the fielder at cover
on the stumps, manages to work one behind square on the leg side
full length, outside off, Buttler works across and ramps the ball over short fine leg for a trademark four
too full again, Buttler frees the arm and carts a full toss over wide long-on for another boundary
pitched up outside off and chipped to long-off on the bounce
shorter and tickles the ball into the off side for one
length ball outside the line of off, Buttler backs away and rifles a straight four back past the bowler

that's gone a looooooooooonnnnnngggg way, biggest hit of the night but it's come too late for England. Buttler freed his arms again and powershaked this over long-on, a full swing and meaty connection sending it high into the night, nearly on to the roof of the stand
pushed towards mid-off to get Buttler back on strike
gets the ramp working again, full and wide and flipped over short fine leg for four
dug in short and cracked in front of deep midwicket on the pull this time - that's fifty for Buttler, the first of many in international cricket, you suspect
on the stumps, can't get this one away
back of a length, throws the bat but doesn't connect
pitched up on off stump, Tredwell backs away and threads a drive between extra-cover and mid-off
drives aerially, high off the bat and picks out extra-cover - Buttler's rearguard is snuffed out! Franklin hit the deck hard and Buttler at last mistimed one after a gunpowder-fuelled fifty
steps away and thwacks a back-of-a-length delivery to long-on
well, that's been absolutely smoked into the crowd at deep midwicket by Tredwell, lovely pick up of a fullish ball and a lazy swing for six
goes back and steers one to third man
slower ball wide of the stumps and the batsman fails to connect
full and wide and steered through the covers
back of a length, Finn pulls hard off the back foot and bullets the ball back at Boult, who half tries to catch it, half takes evasive action and ends up getting hit on the shoulder
pitched up outside off and thump through the covers by Tredwell, who thinks he's Garfield Sobers right now
dug in, short and swinging away in the channel - wide
yorker length, fired in and Tredwell jams his bat down on it
pitched up and swatted back past the bowler
England's cunning plan to sneak this one continues to fructify, as Tredwell blocks one down the ground and it sails for a one-bounce four to long-off
full and punched to mid-off
full and outside off, Finn can't quite get under it and the ball dribbles past the bowler
full and straight, you miss, I'll hit - Tredders is castled and Franklin has three. Tredwell was looking to continue his happy thrash but played across the line and saw his stumps splattered
back of a length, hit uppishly towards mid-off and there's a stretching leap to snag the final wicket! New Zealand have completed the job to wrap up a bruising, brutal victory
